intro: Relbunium ovale, commonly known as the oval sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing white or pale pink flowers that attract pollinators. Its adaptations to harsh environments make it an important component of desert and steppe ecosystems.
